title: Great reliable smart lock/app! Only User error
text:
Firstly, the app keeps getting better, it was minimal at first but now has schedules and a little more and thankfully tells you who/how the lock was activated (by the Schlage app only). I can’t believe more people haven’t used the app or bought the lock. Been over 2yrs and I haven’t even changed the AA batteries - still 36% battery. I use AppleTV and HomeKit, I tell my phone all the time to lock or check if it locked/unlocked. Works great with the iWatch and always responsive almost always within 5seconds the lock is activated. I have had a few issues here and there, no more than any other electronic device that’s works nearly flawless. I bought two more Sense locks for the other doors a year later. Quality built construction lock, just keep working on the app and I will continue to tell others this is a must buy tool for a smart home and a seamless way to monitor the locks throughout. 

The reviews are just outright user error, lack of patience, outdated phone/device, one even said it only works within 30’ because of BlueTooth - its WiFi.

title: Wish I knew it was not for investment properties
text: I have a rental property where I installed the lock. I hired a locksmith to do the installation and he had to buy a special adaptor for my door. But then after it was installed, it took 24 hours to start working. I called my internet provider to add the 2G issue as it does not work on 5G. I live out of state. It worked well for about a month. Then it notified me that it lost connection. I called Schlage customer service on a Saturday. They are not open weekends. I called them Monday. They told me to log out and unistall the app to reset it. I installed it and logged back in. That did not fix the issue. After over week, my app is unable to re-connect to my lock remotely. The old codes I put it still work, except the temporary ones. I am unable to record the history of activity, add new codes, unlock and lock it, etc. I realize only after I bought this lock, that I cannot use it remotely. I have to physically be there to reset the app if it gets disconnected. That is a gamechanger and an expensive mistake. I pray Schlage adds this essential feature to their product so that I can keep using this lock. Then it would get 5 stars. Otherwise I will have to go back to my old lock which was unfortunately more reliable than this "smart lock."

title: Works great
text: Easy to install and has worked great since I’ve owned it. I estimate I’ve owed it for 9 months or so without any problems. I’ve changed the batteries once but that is no big deal in my opinion considering how often it’s used. The app told me the batteries were low and they are easy to change. My other locks are the same brand and I was easily able to rekey this lock to my existing key set. I wish I had switched to this type of lock years ago. I have two young kids and live in the northeast so weather can change frequently. Such a convenience to unlock from the car and the kids can get inside while I take groceries etc from the car and spare some wet weather. Plus for my wife to runs and can keep the keys at home. I think people who give this poor reviews may not fully understand what they’ve purchased. Glad I went with the WiFi version instead of the Bluetooth.

title: Schlage lock
text:
We got the lock for our rental property and were so glad to see you only need a ruler and a Phillips head screw driver to install it!  It seemed to need a larger hole in the door for installation so perplexed since it’s a metal door- we called a locksmith who knew to tell us that there’s a component you remove so the lock fits any door hole even an older metal one.  Now I will know when ever people are entering our property.  It’s like a built in guard dog that only needs fresh batteries for food.  I loved how it told me thumb lock or locked by the keypad ... the moment it’s unlocked I am notified.  Very nice features!  Also it fits 100 different codes, and so you can assign the codes to specific guests and when - what hour it will and will not work for them to enter.  
Very smart and such a great piece of mind!!

title: Simple changes would help
text:
(Version 4.1.9)
Having the same button to toggle locked/unlocked can be problematic, as can having the majority of the screen act as the toggle button. I tried to swipe up to get to multitask mode to get into another app, and in the process ended up sending an unlock command to the door. Thankfully I was at home and heard it unlock itself, but if I had been away from home, it may have left my door unlocked without my knowledge. Also, if the app is still open and processing a command when you lock the phone, a command may be sent, then upon unlocking the phone, the app may send a repeat command, which again can be problematic if the app inadvertently sends a second unlock command hours later when you are away from home. An option to get a notification when the lock has been unlocked for more than x amount of time would be nice.
On the plus side, the lock/unlock notifications are handy, as is the autolock option, though customizable time increments would be appreciated.

title: Love the lock/app combo; low battery status needed
text:
Never thought I would fall in love with a deadbolt, but this little guy has helped give me more piece of mind. I can see when my kids (16 & 21) are coming and going without being the overbearing or prying mom. It’s nice to know when I’m out that they have gotten home safely without them having to remember to text me. Basically, none of us have to think of these things, the lock does the heavy lifting for us. 

On a recent trip out of the country I could see that they were leaving the house on time to get to school and when they returned home again. Even though they were an ocean away it made me feel close to them. 

One complaint about the app is that it would be really nice to receive a low battery notification. I don’t use the front door very often (my comings and goings are via the garage), just the boys, so I am dependent on them to tell me when the battery needs to be replaced.

title: Improvements Needed
text:
Notifications: The app notifies on lock/unlock only, and the setting applies to all doors. 
(1) App should support notification on low battery, arguably more useful than notification on lock/unlock. Battery replacement events should go into history and notifications. 
(2) App should support lock/unlock notification by door and by a schedule (e.g., notify me if the door on the side of the house is unlocked between the hours of 10 PM and 6 AM). 

General User Interface: Main page for each lock has (1) one large padlock-looking icon that is colored red for locked state, green for unlocked state, and which can be tapped to lock/unlock, (2) a button to show lock/unlock history, and (3) a battery meter (when battery is low). For owners of more than one lock, one must swipe L/R to see each lock. That main page should show a scrolling list of locks with a smaller padlock icon in the left column, the history button in the center column, and the battery meter in the right column for each lock. I.e., please implement a higher information density solution so that owners can immediately see that all locks are locked. 

Battery Life: I only get six months from a fresh set of batteries (on 3 different Schlage Encode locks). Not an issue with the app, per se, but I’m sharing for those considering Schlage smart locks. 

HomeKit: It’s unfortunate that Schlage Encode locks do not have HomeKit support. $200 locks should give users support for all major smart home platforms.

title: Could be a much better experience.
text: The install of the lock was the best part of the experience. The instructions were good. Getting the lock configured on my network and firmware updates were difficult due to the lock not being found or recognized. About a day later after getting everything working, it worked pretty good for about a month. It then magically lost connection, which I would say was after a software update. I was able to get it back on my wifi, but it is t communicating with their cloud anymore. This prevents me from seeing any history or status. A day later the history finally came in, bit the lock still is having connection issues. Looks like I may have to factory reset and start all over again. Ironically, I can still get in from the keypad. The remote capabilities are weak. I wish they would bypass their cloud and keep everything inside the private network. If their cloud is down or you have authentication issues, the remote features don’t work.

title: Needs help
text: In theory this could be the best app in the App Store. Unfortunately it was left in an immature state and is very unreliable. The communication between the lock and the app is unreliable, unpredictable, inconsistent, generally loses connection to each other, and is not synchronized. The app does not talk directly to the lock when in close range so it requires the use of the internet, which causes a huge delay. Tech support is sub-par. I would have one of their locks on every door if it worked as advertised. Good luck if you go with this Schlage. It’s obvious they don’t quite get the digital thing yet, and they don’t seem to want to move forward either. Everyone who comes to my house loves the concept and wants one when they 1st see it, but then I show them how it doesn’t really work right. Then they realize they don’t want it anymore. It’s a real shame too, because it could have been great. It’s been at least a year now that I have been using it and I don’t see any progress with improvements. Sorry Schlage, your old fashion locks rock but your smart locks are a black eye on your name because the app is so bad.

title: Would like to be able to schedule the time it locks or unlocks
text:
We like the lock and being able to check the status and unlock/lock from the app. We have dogs, so this nice to give the neighbor kid access when we are gone to care for the dogs. 
My biggest suggestion and peeve with the lock: We wish there was a way to schedule the door with time of day to lock or unlock. It’s really annoying to have the only option to lock it after only a few seconds or minutes, especially since it is a door we use regularly throughout the day. It would be nice to set it to lock at specific times instead. We don’t use the auto lock delay because it is so annoying to have to unlock the door every time we go in or out. I will improve our rating if you add this feature!

title: Fantastically reliable device!
text: I have had a Schlage electronic dead bolt on my front door for over 2 years now. It has operated flawlessly and remotely from my i-phone application without failing once. This is essential for me cause I am totally bed-bound at the moment recovering from a serious auto accident. Also since it is battery controlled, when there is a brown out or black out the operation of my door is unaffected. Finally, when being transported from the house for a doctor’s visit or for PT Therapy,, the application immediately reconnects to my Wi Fi when returning home outside of the home without fail. The batteries last for months without needing changing. I recommend it highly for anyone needing help in unlocking and answering the door.

title: Love Schlage keypad locks
text: I have the Schlage Encode on one of my rental properties and the Schlage Sense with separate WiFi Adapter at another rental property.  I love being able to remote control codes and lock operations.  My Schlage Encode is newer with WiFi built in and has been perfect.  The Sense lock has been giving me issues since a software update about six months ago.  I’ve had to restore it to factory settings and re-pair it to WiFi adapter & cell phone a few times.  Working again but it has been having issues reflecting the correct date/time in the history log (even though the “lock time” in the Information tab is always accurate.  It seems to get synchronized occasionally and the losses date/time again in history.  Minor annoyance but important information for my short term rental.

title: So well thought out and well built!
text:
I bought a cheap combination lock for an “owner’s closet”. After spending nearly 4 frustrating hours trying to get it set up, I decided to install the Schlage; what a stark contrast. 

The Schlage product was obviously ver well built and the attention to detail was even more pronounced in the installation directions. Not only were there complete and concise written directions but there were also a step-by-step smartphone instructions complete with videos! The only hiccup I had was that it took me a few tries to connect to the WiFi but that’s not there fault. 

I quickly and easily added multiple users with varying degrees of access. Although I haven’t yet tried the voice activation, we love it!!

title: Enjoying the lock.  Some things I’d like to see..
text:
The lock and app have been one of my favorite things after a major remodel of my house. 

I’d like to see the lock have a compass or other method so it only locks on the timer if the door is closed. I’d like for the open and closed messages to be unified when they are within one minute (or the automatic timer time). I’d like the app to come up with the history,and got the lock and unlock functions to be two separate buttons. I’d like for alerts to exclude specified access codes (I’d set my own to no alert because I know when I go in and out). I’d like an inside button to lock or unlock door. I’d like the batteries to be rechargeable with a plug on the pack or a micro usb charge cable. 

I’d like an alert when batteries are low.

title: Easy to install and reliable app
text:
I bought this Schlage Encode WiFi dead bolt for a standard residential steel door and it works great!  No issues. Easy to install and the app is simple to use and logical.  How often have you purchased a product that has an app to highlight all of its “amazing” functions and the app falls short and consistently underwhelms .  Not the Schlage App!  It works exactly as it should.  I’m happy with it and it is simple to set up and use.  

Dead bolt install was easy. It came with a reinforcement plate on the door jam side for added security.  It is larger then the standard plate and you will need to chisel out a larger recess in the door jam to make it fit.  I recommend a decent chisel and a small drill bit to pilot the larger screws holes.  If you don’t use the pilot drill bit you will risk splitting the wood.   Fatal error. 

This dead bolt works well with security screen doors because it has a thin profile on the exterior side of the door, leaving plenty of room for the security screen doors knob. 

Highly recommend this dead bolt!

title: Remote lock
text: I’ve bought Schlage for years due to quality.  I haven’t been disappointed until the remote access lock. I bought it so my handicapped sister could lock and unlock the door to allow friends and aid workers to visit.  In conjunction with the ring door bell that provided views this gave her security and control.   However the program didn’t allow us to also give codes to aids. It was codes or remote access not both. Then if the door wasn’t shut perfectly it wouldn’t lock.  We simply asked people leaving to hold the door.  The biggest issue was operation. The program had to be reset at least monthly when it wouldn’t work at all.  Summary. It could be a pain and I wouldn’t recommend it for an able bodied person but it was still a great tool for the handicapped.

title: Good Product
text: I had a few issues with the installation of the Schlage sense hub. Once that was worked out the app does what is advertised. One big item I wish they would add is a notification if the lock is left unlocked for a period of time. I have the Chamberlain MyQ app for just that reason. It has a customizable time period before it notifies you that the garage door has remained open. Great for when kids are asking questions when pulling out of the garage and you forget to close garage door. Since the Schlage locks already have the ability to auto lock after a period of time, would it be that hard to add a notification if the the lock is left unlocked for say 20 minutes?

title: Works remotely with Apple TV HD
text:
The app works and does what you need to configure it

After months of frustration, I have finally figured out what was causing my remote access issues no thanks to Schlage or Apple. 

For those of you with lingering issues using it remotely with an Apple TV HD, ensure the following

1) on your Apple TV, make sure that airplay is “On”. You ALSO MUST enable “also allow nearby to airplay“. 

2) after that, you will need to turn off all nearby iOS devices and lock. After rebooting your Apple TV, turn on the lock again and ensure that it connects with your Apple TV.  You can verify if it is connected by asking your Siri my remote if the lock is locked or unlocked. Once connected, it will maintain a connection with your Apple TV

3) now, you should be able to turn on your iOS devices and no longer have issues.

Note:  If you Continue to have issues, you may either need to reset your lock back to factory defaults or you may have Bluetooth interference.  You may try to move your Apple TV closer to the lock or moving other devices that could cause interference further away from your Apple TV. Hope this helps anyone!

title: Pretty easy setup. Could use a few enhancements
text:
I like the look of the lock and it was easy to set up. I strive to be handy, but I’m not. I was still able to install in about 20 minutes. 

I like the ease of it, but I would like to be able to create more useful notifications. Right now it’s just notify every time the door is locked or unlocked which is too many things. I would like to be able to set it to notify me if the door has been left unlocked for more than X minutes. Or just get those lock/unlock notifications around a certain time ranges. 

It seems like a useful feature to add. Otherwise there is rarely ever a need to actually open the app.

title: Works well and is reliable
text:
I question the veracity of those critical reviews which have preceded this.  Perhaps a recent update has fixed all the complaints. My experience has been excellent.  The app was easy to install and set-up and it’s performance in directly locking/unlocking my new Encode wifi deadbolt has been flawless in the weeks since I installed it.

I am a hyper-critical person and do not often write reviews but my experience has been so different from some others, that I feel obligated to do so. I really cannot understand their complaints.  Perhaps my enthusiasm is fed by the problems and un-reliability I experienced with a former Z-Wave system.

title: Good software, but could be better
text: The Schlage app is good software but could be a little better.  I have two suggestions. On the main screen under the lock icon is a circular arrow icon, that I assumed would check the current status. It seems to only check the last record in the history.  If the last history record was a lock that occurred 3 hours ago, after pressing this icon, the message will say “Status as of 3 hours ago”.  That doesn’t instill confidence that the lock is locked now and that it checked current status. My second suggestion is that failed attempts to unlock the lock with the keypad should be recorded in the history.

title: App not as reliable as it should be.
text:
We have the Bluetooth (not WiFi) model at my home and my wife’s business. The locks themselves are fairly reliable are battery efficient. We’ve had them 4 years now and haven’t been let down by the operation at the door.

However, the operation with the app, which is the whole purpose of getting a “smart” lock leaves a lot to be desired. The lock advertised compatibility with apple’s HomeKit system which was a major benefit. I have an Apple TV and a couple of new iPads that stay at home, so theoretically I should be able to control my locks even while I’m away from home. I should be able to see if my doors are locked while away from home, or AT LEAST from across the house right?

Wrong.

Connectivity regularly fails. No matter if you’re using the HomeKit UI or Schlage a own app, there is apparently a difficulty connecting to the lock. 

Recently, Schlage or Apple released an update and since that update you have to be right next to the lock for it to work. We have this years iPhones so our equipment isn’t out of date. The Apple TV is connected over gigabit Ethernet so “WiFi signal” isn’t the issue. It’s software. It’s something that defeats the purpose of owning a “smart” lock.

title: Same inconsistency issues reported by others
text:
As many other users report, the app shows the lock as “unreachable” sporadically with no apparent pattern, rhyme or reason.  Frustrating. When the app works (ie, when it is able to connect to the lock remotely), it is pretty great. And the lock itself is awesome. But the app is very inconsistent as to when it works and when it doesn’t. (Contrary to a recent review from April 12, this is not user error.)

One issue that is always present, even when it is able to reach the lock, concerns the expanded history tab- when I am away from the house and click “show more history,” it doesn’t load more history but just shows the spinning dial to indicate more history is loading (it only loads more history I’m at home, physically close to the actual lock. Again, not user error.)

title: Firmware update fail
text: The hardware is fine, and the app functionality is okay, but the firmware just will not update. My lock is on 4.27 and the app wants to update to 4.31 but it fails every time. At 15 minutes per attempt it is a huge time waster. There is no status updates during the update, just a slow moving progress bar. The instructions are not very clear either: keep app open and phone near lock…okay, so the last attempt I sat 1 foot from the lock, with the Schlage app open, rubbing my screen constantly so the phone won’t sleep the screen but still get a fail. Firmware should update even if the phone locks. The app is still running. If there is a fail, the app should provide some feedback (did the update start on the lock, fail to complete, amd rollback, or did the app lose connection with the device, or, or….?

title: Worth the price
text: When I purchased this lock 3 years ago I had no idea how much I would come to love it, both for its function and convenience.  The ability to program codes for different users and allow or restrict access has been invaluable.  For the most part it also works well with my iphone (Siri and the home app).   The only disadvantage has been the inability to reach the lock when away from home and the slightly touchy keypad which sometime requires several try’s for new users.  All in all, well worth the money and I’ve recommended in numerous times to friends and family.

title: Love it!
text: The app and lock have performed exactly as expected. We like that our kids do not have to carry keys and I get alerted when they get home from school. My only suggestion is to allow for a longer auto lock duration. 4 minutes is not long enough. The deadbolt has damaged the wood around our door when the auto lock has triggered and then the door is shut. I love the idea of being able to set a schedule for auto lock as someone else suggested. At a minimum, please allow us to set a 15 minute duration. Thank you!

title: Love the lock....hate the app
text: I love the lock so much that I just bought the same type for my mom. It’s an awesome lock and Schlage is a great company. I wish I could say the same for the app. It only syncs with the lock when I’m on my property and, unlike a previous reviewer stated, it is not down to user error.  We experience many of the same issues other users are experiencing: no history, not locating the lock, unreachable, etc. I sold my family on letting me install this lock at my mom’s new home in her senior community so we could monitor who comes and goes. The particular selling point was we could monitor everything remotely through the app.   I’m hoping the new lock syncs up with the app I loaded on her phone better than it does on mine, but I’m not going to get my hopes up.

title: App crashes
text: I have two  Schlage door locks.  When I go to setting for front door, app crashes.  If I go to setting in second door, I can adjust setting.  I’m trying to disable first door alarm which must have high sensitivity setting, however I can’t because app crashes.  I call Schlage and they stated it’s the first time they heard of this and brought to higher level engineers to figure out.  It’s been over a week now and door alarm is getting annoying.  I have my first lock which has the problem for about 3-4 years now and second door lock for about 1 1/2 years. Never had a problem before and both locks still works well with Apple homekit.

title: Working fine until recently
text: There is a sudden lapse in notifications, lock shows locked when unlocked, locked when locked .. I don’t see a notification for hours. This has made me very uncomfortable with this lock all of a sudden. It is in an office in a locked building - with the way the app is functioning, I would not rely on it for my front door. Also the remote lock/unlock by a single tap would be great if it worked flawlessly. Instead, we are now driving to our office in the middle of the night since the app is sometimes saying it is locked and sometimes not and not responding to touching the lock icon but then may respond an hour later. Someone needs to get on it to get this resolved

title: Could use some updated features
text: The lock itself works well, however the app is not so great. Many times I do not get notifications for when the door is opened. Even today the last update was from last night, and there has been a lot of activity but it won’t show us even when we refresh. Also the feature to autolock should also allow the ability to choose a range of time for the door to be unlocked, for example from 9am - 9pm the door can stay unlocked, and if anyone comes in at night then it will auto lock after 4 minutes, etc. I really wanted to like this lock and app but it just falls short.

title: Slow To Connect-Requires Additional Device
text: We purchased a new front door and the seller offered this lock with as an add on with the hardware. I already had a Schlage Connect (which connects nicely with my Wink hub) lock on the door but decided I could move it to the back door. Great plan until the new door was installed with the Schlage Sense. Now I have buy a Schlage WiFi adapter for 80 bucks so, maybe I can use it with Alexa and so maybe I can get alerts when the lock is unlocked or so I can lock or unlock it when I am not home. Plus, I had to install another frikken app on my iPhone. I have to wait and wait and wait for the app to connect just to use it at home. Very frustrating that it is not compatible with your other locks.

title: False notifications
text: We have several of the Encode deadbolts in our home and loved them...up until last night/early this morning when we started receiving numerous notifications of various doors being unlocked and locked again throughout the night while we were asleep. Obviously, waking up to these notifications was alarming, but then after checking all doors and seeing that they are indeed locked (while some notifications continued to come through saying otherwise) and checking the history within the app which showed all doors remained locked throughout the night, we are left with anger and frustration over an app and products that should bring us comfort and security but are now causing unnecessary panic. PLEASE FIX YOUR APP!!

title: Best modern tech
text:
This device is great. Allows in my home (which is the old school everyone always coming over) for multiple people to enter without keys. And me to be able to change the entry when I no longer want them to have access. 

Also, have several rental properties. Has revolutionized short term rental. No longer have to worry about getting keys to or from renters. 

I love it. Highly recommend. I have purchased five. Well worth the money. Easy to install customer service is outstanding.

title: Unreliable app, good lock
text: I’ve never had an issue with the Schlage Sense lock itself, but the app has been unreliable. I recently bought the wifi adapter so that I can check my door is locked when I’m away, unlock remotely, etc. It worked fine for about five days. I’m out of the country and while it still shows my door as locked, suddenly I get an error message when I try to view the history and I’ve stopped receiving notifications for no apparent reason. I also can’t access my codes to view or add. I spent an additional $55 for features I can no longer use. Frustrating to say the least.

title: 5 ⭐️minus 1
text: I’ve had my locks for about a year now and I absolutely love them.  The app is great and easy to use; however, I am unable to update to my new email address within the settings.  Because everything is tied into my HomeKit, I don’t want to delete the app and start again out of fear that everything will screw up.  I get many companies don’t allow this option for “security” reasons, but it makes things difficult for the consumer - especially if they no longer have their former email address.  For now, I will just keep things as they are.

title: Fantastic App!!!
text:
This lock we have is on a second home we rent out on AirBnB and other booking sites and it is absolutely fantastic!  It has worked almost flawlessly since the day it was installed.  Only issue was a power outage happened and I couldn’t access the lock however when the power came on all was good once again and it was not the apps fault that’s for sure.  I can easily allow a contractor or cleaner access and I am 300 miles away. 
I’d suggest this setup to anyone with a second home.

title: Skilled with experience
text:
Not all doors have the same exact replacement fits. Some skilled modifications may be needed on the woodwork. The product and the app work As I sit here locking and unlocking the door and receiving notifications. If the power or internet is out, I have a lockbox with the keys provided to manually gain access. I carry the second key as I normally have for redundancy. 

The audible and backlit functions give auditory and visual confirmation of the lock or unlock status.

The quality is sound and attractive

title: Randomly Unlocks Sometimes
text: We have had this lock for about 10 months and for the most part, we love it. We love the convenience of it and freedom it gives us to leave our house cleaner alone knowing that she will lock the door without giving her a key. But…..the biggest issue we have with it is that sometimes it unlocks by itself and for no reason. In the last 2/3 months it unlocked in the middle of the night. Once at midnight and the second time was at 4:00 am. This worries a lot and there is a major glitch in the system that needs to be fixed to give me and my family the peace of mind. There is no excuse for this lock to unlock itself. I am considering taking it off if I knew what to replace it with.

title: Front Door Lock - Keypad model
text: This replaced a 20 year old conventional deadbolt lock that was failing to open consistently. I was able to remove the old lock myself, but had a locksmith complete the installation.  Battery life is great, I just replaced the original set today. That’s 7 months on one set! Got a warning that the batteries were low on the app. Also nice to have a key in case the batteries fail while you are outside. Highly recommended as a new or replacement front door lock. ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️

title: Simple Installation and Setup
text: Very easy to install and setup.  Just download the app and follow the step by step video instructions.  Only issue I had was the wifi setup that took about 2 tries before it connected to home wifi (maybe because of 3 out 4 signal bar).  But after it connected, the lock worked flawlessly.  As long as you have wifi or cell phone signal, you can unlock and lock door anywhere with the app.  I will connect Alexa and Google Mini after using the app remotely in a week.  Schlage Encode is the best!

title: Great WiFi alternative
text: I’d been looking for a lock that didn’t require me to install yet another Hub in order operate.  We have great WiFi at our home (Ruckus Wireless) and this lock works flawlessly once setup.  I can enter temporary codes, unlock it remotely, auto-lock after 2-minutes of being unlocked, and all utilizing the WiFi that already exists in my home.  No additional equipment required.  A great option for those who love IoT, but hate having to install and manage a new Hub for every manufacturers product suite.

title: Almost Perfect!
text:
I bought the Schlage Encode and tried it out against 3 other smart locks and it blew them all out of the water. I love the app and how easy and intuitive it is. 

My ONLY wish is the the ability to turn Guest codes off, like a toggle button, or a master toggle off button. The app does have a schedule, but I would love a manual toggle switch to disable/enable accounts. The only way to do that now is to delete the account and add it again or use a schedule, which can sometimes be hard to predict. 

My only wish to an awesome app!

title: False (Maybe) unlock notification
text: Starting last night I got a notification on my phone that the lock unlocked and then locked.  I checked my door, it was locked.  I checked the ring which didn’t show any activity.  I checked the lock history in app nothing but I have found that it doesn’t record everything.  Tonight it happened again, notifications unlocked and locked.  After this I replaced the batteries and after twenty minutes again notification of unlocked and locked.  I have removed the batteries and am waiting to see what happens.  Perhaps there is a bug in a recent app update?  Might be time to find something new that has reliable history.

title: Good thinking!
text: My husband and I downsized to a villa from 30 years in a house in Jupiter. When we changed our door to a storm door with a decorative window in it to let in light and allow us to see out, we wanted a lock that was secure and found it. What a plus that it came with an application to allow us to lock and unlock it with ease. We are going through some health issues which are challenging to say the least and this lock is making a few things easier, and that’s saying a lot. Thank you!

title: Best thing that ever happened to door locks!
text: I absolutely love this automatic  door lock !! It is so handy to be able to unlock  and lock my door with my phone whenever I need to. I really enjoy being able to unlock my door in the evening when I come home and it’s dark.  I can unlock it and then go directly to the house knowing it’s open, and I don’t have to fumble around trying to get in. Thanks so much for this great lock! I would recommend it to everyone!!

title: Security and Peace of Mind
text:
We purchased our home several years ago and during that time we had several keys handed out to family members just in case there was an emergency and we were out of town. That being said, I noticed a young man looking around my porch on my security cameras. I changed out both the handle and the deadbolt to match.  

No more having y to wonder of the door is secure. The app allows you see that it is open or locked.

title: Good layout design but unreliable
text:
This app is laid out nicely and works well when it works. It is completely random when the notifications will and will not work. Some days notifications work every time and other days only sporadically and other days not at all. That and it asking for access to bluetooth every single time the app is opened is an annoyance.

Update:  i appreciate the developer offering assistance. However, I have been in touch with Schlage directly both via email and telephone to no avail. They even sent a whole new lock to try and resolve the issues, but the new lock did the same things.

title: Worked fine for about a month
text: I have no idea if it’s the lock that’s defective, or the app. I bought it about a month ago and loved it. Then yesterday I started getting notifications that the door was unlocked then locked. This is my front door we’re taking about, so of course I’m freaked out about the lock randomly unlocking at night. Then today I noticed that not everything was reported in the lock history. I changed the batteries then nothing at all was showing up. I deleted it from the app and now it won’t connect to WiFi at all so I now have a $250 deadbolt does the same thing as a $30 deadbolt.

title: Easy, Simple and Convenient
text: Can not believe how easy it was to install my new Schlage Encode smart lock. And I wish I had done sooner on our out of town condo. We had issues after purchasing our condo that required service people needing access to the unit. This was a problem because we were 1,200 miles away. We could not find people to help. This lock and the remote locking capabilities eliminates all those problems.

title: Great lock for Apple Homekit and on it’s own
text: Works well and paired instantly. Installation was very easy and the install video is one of the best I’ve seen for any accessory. I may be missing it but the Schlage app should be lockable with a passcode, touch-id and face id. You can add users and codes in the app so you don’t really just want it out there. Also, it didn’t affect me but the 2 default codes on my paperwork didn’t work after installation. I just went into the app and added my own codes. Very happy with it so far.

title: Great Product works as advertised
text: I really like this app and our Schlage smart lock. Connects to our WiFi and stays. Alerts us when locked, unlocked, or a forced entry attempt. This app allows customized settings including auto (re)lock. The one feature I’d like to see added is the ability to auto lock at a certain time (ie 10pm every night) in case door is left unlocked and/or a “door unlocked“ reminder. Thanks!

title: Doesn’t update properly and false notifications
text:
Like many others have said, when it works it’s great. However, for a device that’s protecting the front door of my house, it needs to work 100% of the time. Getting false notifications that the door is unlocked at 1AM in the morning is not ok. Especially when the lock isn’t actually unlocked. 

The app also has latency issues. And no. It’s not because of the WiFi as my router is literally less than 10 feet away with full signal. It doesn’t update when the door unlocks and/or locks immediately. 

Schlage needs to fix this ASAP because this is a fatal flaw for a supposed security device.

title: Crap App, Good Lock
text:
I love that you can remotely input codes and lock/unlock your door... but that’s only when the app is working, which it isn’t a frustrating amount of the time. When it does work, it’s incredibly slow, like set the phone down and come back after taking a shower slow.

The lock, on the other hand, works great! Stylish, easy to use, and sturdy, though it doesn’t not agree with lots of water. It’s got good torque when locking, though I wish it had more when it comes summer time and the door expands so much the lock has a tendency to jam.

We are also testing the Nest lock, which has a MICH BETTER app, but the torque doesn’t seem as good.

title: “Unreachable”
text: Unable to get the app to work. I have followed instructions including resetting the lock, restarting my phone, updating the app. After restarting and resetting, the app will work nicely while I’m standing next to the lock. But walk somewhere else and “unreachable” appears again. I hope apple or the developer can intervene.  After paying extra for this feature and all of the trouble it took to install, it would be a relief to have this working correctly.

title: Please move the location of the Delete All button
text: I love the lock! And I love everything about the app except the location of the Delete All button. I'm so afraid I'm going to accidentally delete all the lock codes when I swipe up to close the app on my iPhone. That would lock out my BnB guests! I would have given the app a 5 star rating if it weren't for that. Please move that button to someplace where we couldn't possibly hit by accident. Thanks!

title: Satisfied but it could be better.
text: This “smartbolt” lock as it is set up works fine.  It needs awareness of the status of the door. Is the door closed and latched? Is the door not latched? Is the door standing open? All this information could be gathered from switches on a passage lock with a split bolt. If someone opened and closed the door during the time-out interval, that interval could be reset. If the door is standing open or not latched at the end of the time-out period it could flag the caretaker that info.

title: Works, but slow for many. WiFi doesn’t work.
text:
We have about 10 people authorized on our lock. For six of them, opening the door takes nearly a minute. At first the lock shows open (it’s locked), but the last status was several months ago when the app was used to open the lack the day before. About a minute after touching the button something times out and the lock shows Locked as it should. You can then open the lock.

We could never get the WiFi interface adapter to work even with support. It looks like the adapter is somehow incompatible with our WiFi network. I suspect we are using a level of security the adapter doesn’t support.

title: Best phone help available!
text: Oh boy, did we need help! We are tech-dino’s and struggled pairing our Schlage lock to our phones. After a short hold, we connected with Joe and he *patiently* walked us through every step necessary to make that happen…twice! His calm manner was so reassuring. I think we interrupted him 20 times but he kept on keeping on! The app really offers a lot of options and we’re happy using it.

title: Consistent issues with the app
text: I don’t use the app that often - maybe once a week. But when I do I have a problem every single time so it’s not usually a quick way lock/unlock your door. The app will log me out and not always allow facial recognition, just now all my access codes have completely disappeared and I’m hoping they return so I don’t have to set them again, and it often disconnects itself from the WiFi even when there’s been no outage. When I first installed this lock I loved it. Since I had to update the app with a new WiFi password about year ago - it’s been having constant issues.

title: Updated Review: App update no good, no customer service available
text: Bought the lock and got it installed. App set up was easy and I was all linked up. App advised I needed an update and so installed that. Now the app won’t recognize my lock. Attempted to call customer service and stayed on hold for 35 minutes without an answer. Sent an email to the customer service department and haven’t heard from anyone... it’s been two days now. Did get a reply to my original review saying they are sorry for the negative experience...and nothing else. No support option provided.  well that doesn’t help my situation as the app still doesn’t work.

title: Does what I need it to
text: But I wish it was better integrated with iOS. If this app supported shortcuts then we could have Siri integration for any of their smart locks, regardless of the lack of HomeKit support. Look at the ButterflyMX app as an example: it has a registered “unlock” action so a simple shortcut setup Siri for “Hey Siri, unlock the door.” This could be fairly easily done here too, and I wish it were. It would also be nice to have tap-and-hold shortcuts (same actions, actually) to lock and unlock from the icon instead of opening the app.

title: Flawless
text: I installed front and back door electronic deadbolts linked with Apple Home and Schlage app and both have worked flawlessly for over a year. I can open locks using my iPhone or the keypad on the doors or the keys. I can monitor my locks when away from home with the app through my phone. A great addition to a security system so get them. I have used locks from Schlage for 45 years without failure.

title: Security flaw
text: I just found that the firmware on my lock auto updated itself at 3am while I was sleeping and 300 miles away from my home. I contacted customer service and he confirmed encode firmware are auto pushed. I am really disappointed that the app does not at least allow me to defer firmware updates until I am home. I wonder what happened if the update failed or corrupted the access codes.

title: Lock has difficult time finding wifi, and staying connected.
text:
I purchased encode lock.  Installation was really easy. 
However, the lock took me four hours to connect to WiFi,it worked on blue tooth.  
Lock also looses wifi connection frequently, and totally unpairs from lock which takes away all smart functionality. 
I  still testing lock but am very frustrated.

title: 2 years and working well
text: Our WiFi lock has been flawless for daily use over 2 years. Only feature we wish it had would be automatically lock every night at 9 pm. This lock is on our shop door, which is open daily, but it would be neat if it would lock the door at 9 pm automatically each night so I don’t have to remember

title: Pretty sweet
text: Though it took two attempts to set it up on the Wi-Fi, it works great. There’s something cool about sitting on the couch and watching the door lock and unlock with the push of a button. What I don’t get though, is that it’s supposed to be able to use the Samsung smart things app. You have to have a ‘hub.’ So that might be the only drawback, another app for another smart home device.

title: No HomeKit support?
text: I picked up a BE489WB this weekend and was disappointed that it doesn’t work with Apple HomeKit. Yes I skimmed the box and missed that it said Schlage Home app.... I think it’s crazy that the old lock will work with HomeKit and this one will not. I also don’t see anything about programming the unit to lock at specific times of the day. I imagine this is something that could be setup with those other non Apple devices. I just think it’s a step backwards. I will say that even with the app being extremely basic it does lock and unlock when I push the button.

title: Homekit integration still very unreliable
text: The app itself is ok, but since iOS 12 Homekit integration has been very unreliable. I have move Apple Tv4 to within a couple of meters away from lick. Have tried everything s from a factory reset to apple tv rest. Lots of tedious, unnecessary work. For a few iOS versions it worked, then failed again. About to to purchace schlage wifi adaptor and abandom homekit. Apple and schlage have give me the run around, blaming each other. Very frustrating because otherwise it is a great lock.

title: Lock notification acting funky
text:
We have had this lock for up to a year now and it had worked well. But Dec 2021 and before Christmas day, the notifications have not been coming through to the phones as it should. Before this time, notification show up on the phone instantaneously. Now, it takes it a while. I mean at least 30 minutes delay and false notification that the lock is unlocked when it is not.

Schlage needs to fix issues with their systems and let customers know if they've been hacked.

title: Status shows unlocked yet history shows locked
text:
An ongoing, intermittent troublesome issue that deeply concerns us is when the status shows an unlocked symbol yet the lock history shows locked by touchscreen with the time. 
This discrepancy certainly is worrisome because you then are not sure the door is really locked. 
When you press the center of the green unlock symbol, the symbol then shows a red locked symbol yet the lock history does not reflect that. It still shows locked by touchscreen with the original locked time. 
Why does this happen & is there any way to prevent this?
Is the door actually locked the first time which is why the lock history does not change?
This issue is our biggest problem with this lock. 
Overall, we love this lock.

title: Regularly looses connection to WiFi
text: It seems like about 2 times a week the app isn’t able to find the lock. I use the WiFi adapter which runs in the 2.4 network. Most things I use run on 5 but I have a few others on the 2.4. They work fine but for the lock to start working again through the app I have to turn off the router and then it will work again for a few days. I think the WiFi adapter needs updates or something so it stops loosing its connection.

title: Ideal functionality is ALMOST there...
text: Needs a “Disable” toggle. Would be be much easier to temporarily remove access without having to change programming times on the ”Temporary” scheduling setting. Do this and I’ll vote 5 stars all day long UPDATE June 15, 2020. The functionality request has not been added and I’ve received no feedback from Schlage. Dropped my score from a 4 for these reasons. UPDATE SEPT 2021. Nothing has changed. Very disappointed this simple addition can’t be made.   New lock history UI is nice.

title: Unreliable
text: The lock worked fine for the first 6 months but for the last 6 months it stops working without any explanation.  We’ve changed the batteries even before they were low and it still quits working.  I remove the cover, take battery case out a little and replace and it starts working again but we never know how long that will last or why it is happening.   We really like all the features of this lock, and when it works it’s a rock star, but having to have a second lock box with an actual key for when this lock doesn’t work defeats the purpose!

title: Love these locks!
text:
We have these locks on our homes and work great to give access to family members when we aren’t there.  We’ve tried different brands but hands down these are the best. 
The only thing I’d love to see added is an app for the watch as often times my phone isn’t with me and it’d be great to be able to unlock it using my watch.

title: WiFi adapter.
text: Everything has been fine until I tried to connect the aforementioned, still have not been able to.  Also I like the locking from the phone but it also opens and that I don’t care for since in today’s world the signal can be intercepted and the rest is history.  Otherwise I recommend this lock.

title: App works great
text: I’m thankful we got the locks that worked on WiFi and the app. While installing the lock we didn’t connect it completely right and after about a week the keypad didn’t work, and we hadn’t add the key to anyone’s keychain. Thankful with the app we were able to get in and out until we realize and fixed the problem.

title: Not Responding/unreachable
text: Goes offline occasionally for no apparent reason, showing  as not responding/ unreachable. Meanwhile, all other accessories in my system are responding just fine. Not a huge deal, if you’re home, but a real pain if you’re trying to verify the current status of the lock or give someone access remotely. Understand nothing is perfect, but happens too often for an expensive device from a reputable company like this. Would give it 2.5 stars, if I could

title: Old review gone
text:
So today the lock started working. Don’t know why. Let’s see if it can work for more than a week (which will be 5 weeks out of 156 weeks!

Well I’ll keep this up.
V1 of lock was trash.
To their credit Schlage sent me V2 for free 
For 3 years lock has worked properly about 27 days.
Newer locks (V3 or V4?) have no issues; wish Schlage would replace ALL older defective locks.

FIX found 
1. Call Schlage, tell them what they already know. That these things are junk. They won't argue with you. Demand a refund... even if it has been 14 months since you bought them.
2. Email them your receipts and serial numbers.
3. Get your refund check.
4. Throw Schlage locks in trash where they belong.
5. Go buy the new Premis Locks from Kwikset - they work: half the footprint in size, way quieter, app is a zillion times more advanced.
The End.

title: Great product
text:
This is a great product and app. I got 3 of these for the doors on my home and the installation was easy and they all work well. I love that I don’t have to reach for my keys every time I leave or come home. 
There is however one improvement I would like to see in the app and that is a ‘dashboard’ view that shows the status of all locks on one page (like for security cameras). As it is right now I have to swipe through 3 screens to see if my doors are all locked.

title: Suggestions for the developer
text:
I am just writing this review in the hope the developing team can see it. The app is great and I am happy withe the lock also.

It would be nice to see in the notification who is locking or unlocking the lock. We have to go to the history to do that. That would save time and be much more convenient. 

Also, having statistics would be great like how many times the door was locked/unlocked during the day/month/year etc..

title: Great app but....
text: I really enjoy this app, it’s easy to use and assign codes to friends and visitors. My only complaint is the app can only run on one smartphone, if you want to have another user you have to use HomeKit and I don’t want to. Can you please fix this? Sometimes I don’t have my phone with me and I’d like to get notifications on my iPad or let my wife to open the door from her phone and get notifications too. Thanks!

title: Lousy
text:
About 20% of the time, the app does not connect to my lock and I have to restart the entire app to get it to work. Sometimes it just never does, and I have to go use another entrance to my home. I could never rely exclusively on this app to gain reliable entry.

Oh and just today, the paired lock just disappeared entirely from my app. Wiped clean. Out of nowhere. Now have to add it from scratch again.

Hugely disappointed, Schlage - as long as your app remains this lousy, you’re making it impossible for me to be a loyal customer of your smart hardware.

title: Keypad issues
text: Having issues with the keypad. My lock is only 4 months installed. The keypad is dead. Batteries changed twice. Lock works only with the app. I see others online saying the same. No troubleshooting info available for this issue. Very unhappy with this product. The review is blocked if you put one or two stars. Pathetic.

title: Connectivity Intermittent
text: My lock is brand new.   I connect to it with my iPhone app and am able to lock / unlock it.   Then the next minute it isn’t connected and I cannot open the lock.   Basically it doesn’t work.  I share a virtual lock with another person.  They download the app, create an account, and login.  They never are able to connect to the lock.   It always shows as unavailable.   Basically I don’t know how I can rely on this lock.

title: Works great, wish it integrated w other apps
text:
The app and lock work great!
The lock has four AA batteries that lasts about 6 months and the app indicates battery strength. 
The app allows you to program users with specific dates, times or always. And of course you can just lock or unlock with the app. 
I’ve had it for a year and I 100% recommend it.

title: Notifications
text:
The app did not always let me know when the lock was turned. I am not sure if the Internet was off? Or just what happened, but there were several hours where it did not report the locking mechanism. 
Also, the time was not synced for quite a while when I first set this up. It is finally synced now, but it was several hours off. I am not sure why.

title: Great lcck
text: This lock has made my life so much easier. While my house was being worked on, I could tell when and who was going in the house, when they left and if the door was locked. It also makes it so much easier for me when I come home with a bag of groceries. I can unlock the door from the car and walk right in.

title: Good app but resets password about every two weeks
text: I have these locks with app on mine and my wife’s iPhone.  Works well but logs me and my wife off randomly and we have to remember password while away.  Very frustrating feature.  I would go into more detail about other characteristics but this one issue has my wife to the point of wanting me to look at other remote locks with apps that don’t log you off after a week or two.

title: Peace of mind
text: I have so much peace of mind that I can check to see whether my door is locked after I’ve driven away or after my kids have come and gone from the house. You can also set up different codes for different people in your house so you can tell who has come and gone as well. This is really handy with teenagers.

title: Love the Features
text: The install of the lock was simple. The programming was not as easy and required a call to Schlage customer service. However, it took 15 minutes to get WiFi connected after a factory reset.  All of the features are as advertised and I feel great about all of the convenience this product affords.

title: Pretty good, minor adjustments needed.
text: Everything seems functionally sufficient so far.  But at least the first time through the interface seems a bit unclear.  Probably the simplest change would be making the very large lock/unlock indicator a bit smaller, so that the other functions can be more clearly expressed.

title: Love this lock!
text: I’ve been using this lock system for almost a year! I have a short term rental and can manage my lock remotely from anywhere! I am also alerted each time the door is unlocked and by whom It saves over 30 individual codes and each can be disabled as needed. Love the convenience and information the app supplies!

title: Great lock!
text: I use this on an outdoor gate for our property. We have an Airbnb with 3 rentals here. I am able to assign a passcode per person from anywhere I have WiFi...and enable it and disable it easily. I can let a friend or worker in even when not home, or from the comfort of my recliner. We tried at least 3-4 locks within about 6 months and they all gave up. This is a wonderful smart lock!!!

title: Frustrating
text: Hi love the Schlage locks and think our product works great, but the app is definitely frustrating at time. EVERY single time I’ve tried to access my history of the lock, it always comes back as an error and states it can’t access the history. My operating system is up to date and the app version is as well, but I still always have this issue.

title: Great app! One recommendation...
text: I run an AirBnB and enjoy using this lock. I would like a feature request for the app. Having the ability to set a specific date range using a calendar for additional access codes is a must. Right now it’s only a recurring weekly schedule. This does not work for AirBnB use case. PLEASE add this feature, developers!

title: Dissatisfied
text: Perhaps they have a better product out there, for the most part when I’m home it works. But if I’m out of town, is when I need to count out it, so that’s the priority, and it has failed me every time. From batteries dead in the first year multiple times to the power going off in my community; then you have to actually be at home to reprogram it. Too bad it can’t reboot itself as no one can predict an outage due to weather. Also do not get anywhere with the multiple techs this company provides me to trouble shoot with, I might as well not call.

title: Camelot smart lock.
text: complaint. Good quality, but alert sound is small. I am very satisfied when I can check the smart lock when I am outside my home. Easy to set up and I can use cellular or out side network or bluetooth to connect the smart lock. I can lock lock or open the lock when I am in anywhere.

title: Reliable
text:
It has been 4 years and one major power surge, requiring new WiFi. Reconnection  to new WiFi needed resetting the adapter. Very simple, just follow the instructions. 
In general so far no major problem, you can see it in google home, but it only works from it’s own app. Our model is not compatible with Apple home kit.

title: Easiest DIY ever
text:
Installing the lock in the door was super easy. Matching the bolt to the door jamb not so easy. Overall very satisfied

Been a couple weeks and have added it to Google Home so “Hey Google Bedtime” not only shuts off lights and reviews tomorrow’s schedule for me but now locks the door. Pretty cool. Plus have added others access in case they need to get in

title: Once installed, it’s amazing
text: I had some installation issues but now they’re in the past, this product is phenomenal. It works wonderfully. I can add, change and delete lock codes from anywhere, in real time, and get a notification every time someone uses the front door. I’m super happy with this lock.

title: Very confusing instructions
text: The instruction of the WiFi lock are not clear. The lock allegedly can connect to your WiFi directly however it doesn’t and no smart home app (Google hone or Alexa) seems to be able to recognize this lock without having a hub. Installations was very quick and simple but connectivity leaves a lot to be desired

title: Outstanding Feature
text: We love this modern feature of our home. We never have to worry about leaving the door unlocked. We can have our cleaning person or house sitter an access to our home without having to create a spare key. Most importantly we can label their access name so we know who’s visiting.

title: Status is almost always a few hours old
text:
The functionality is decent but the user interface could use some work and the status is almost always old. Currently mine says it's locked but "Status as of 2 hours ago". What good is that?

Edit: evidently this is the way it's supposed to work. That's a shame. If I hit refresh on the lock status, it should say "Status as of 1 second ago". It doesn't. Why even have a refresh button? The same problem exists when checking the status of the Wi-Fi adapter.

title: Great improvement
text: Because I needed several of these, I tried a less expensive brand. BIG MISTAKE. They were from a fairly reputable competitor sold everywhere. They were absolute junk. I thought it was my Wi-Fi, but it was the inferior product. The Encode works flawlessly. They are still new, but no complaints so far.

title: App is Perfect Except No Low Battery Notifications
text: This app has been working great for me, except there is one feature oversight. I manage short term rentals and a push notification warning for low battery status would be extremely useful. If developers could address this in a future version I would be happy to change rating to 5 stars!

title: This lock is perfect
text: I wanted to get a keyless lock I could easily program for different people and could work it remotely. This one is very easy to install (took about 20 minutes) and the software app is easy to understand. Works on my wifi with no adapter needed which was a key point for me.

title: Great, except...
text: We normally go in and out of the garage, but have the lock on the front door. Any reason why, when there are app notifications that the door is locked or unlocked, there isn’t a phone notification that my battery is low??? I mean, I can SEE it’s low if I check the app. But I don’t use the app often...no need to. So why can’t it be set to provide a pop-up notification that the battery is low?

title: Does not work with iOS 13
text: My Schlage lock would not connect immediately after downloading most recent Apple iOS 13 ofn my XS Max. I had the lock connected to WiFi adapter able to control lock remotely without issue for two years. Now with new update the lock cannot be located on the app. It does work with my iPad that hasn’t been updated. Schlage please work with Apple to correct. So disappointed it doesn’t work anymore on iphone. You’d think an update would represent progress? Unfortunately it’s one step forward, two steps back. Your companies are better than this.

title: Lazy
text:
Are we continually setting ourselves up for dependency on all these amazing remote devises?  Smart homes are like the car purchase with every option that now you can’t live without!  

To “unplug” has become way more than just reverting back to a flip phone....

The lock works perfectly as described.

title: A Good, But Not Great App
text: I use this app daily for my Schlage door locks. If I had any suggestions they would be: (a) Add location services so it knows which lock I’m nearest. And (b) provide faster and more intelligent connection when I’m near the lock. Often it connects within a few seconds, but it sometimes takes 30 seconds or more toll, and sometimes it hangs.

title: Lock and unlock
text: Love everything about the product, with one exception it takes a long time for lock or unlock option to open so I can unlock the door for a guest in a timely manner, and I have the latest iPhone, other than that I highly recommend it.

title: New History feature
text: Like the easier to read color and font but not sure if 0 events which can be numerous, will be able to be deleted to get out of the way to more older events that can be important to keep around

title: Pretty Good
text: The lock is great and works as designed but it would be nice if it had schedules built in so that you can change the auto locking and how it functions based on time.  For example, being able to auto lock after 3 minutes during the day but 10 seconds at night or not to auto lock during the day but auto lock during the night.

title: App use is buggy.
text: The hardware works really well, but the app is weird. Weird in a way that the lock  can’t seem be found on opposing apps. If I had installed it thru HomeKit, it would work with HomeKit, but the lock couldn’t be reachable when the Schlage home app is used. If I installed thru Schlage home app, it’ll work properly but could not be paired into Apple HomeKit. I Have done the power cycle, reset to factory settings, but non would work to make lock reachable/discoverable on either app after installation from the two respective install approach.

title: Apple Watch?
text: The app and lock has worked flawlessly and has really helped when my wife was ill and made it easier for friends to visit and alerting me who was there along with health care workers.  It would be a nice addition to perhaps add an Apple Watch app so that you could unlock and lock using that instead of using my phone

title: As easy to install and use as it says!
text: I didn’t really believe that all I would need was a screwdriver to install this keypad entry system, but that’s all it took!  I installed it easily and downloaded the app, which allows me to remotely lock and unlock the door. Huge fan. Highly recommend!

title: Anybody can do it
text: Incredibly easy to install and setup. I’ve had trouble with door locks and doors in general in the past and was surprised how easy this was to get up and running. They even included Duracell batteries. I know how a safe, professional-looking key pad and lock that I can operate over my phone!

title: Times out at times
text: Most of the time it works great. However, too many times it fails to find the locks, just spins instead of locking the doors. When it works it is nice to lock without having to go down stairs.  It is also nice to check if you remembered to lock the doors whether you’re upstairs or out and about.

title: Mr. Howard
text: After installing the Schlage Sense, I had a challenge pairing it with my phone. I call for support and the young lady was very helpful and walked me through the steps easily. Needless to say, my problem was a result of operator error. I’m thankful for their assistance. I would definitely recommend this lock to friends and family.

title: Needs Apple Watch Support!  There are very few apps that have a mor practical use on the watch!
text: Other than the missing Apple Watch support this is a great app and great lock (Encode). I would not mind Apple Home Kit support being added to the lock via a firmware update, but that is not the app’s fault. The app has never failed to connect to the lock or give me a status update. Firmware updates have been smooth.

title: Rental Game Changer
text:
This tool takes your rental experience to the next level it makes everything so easy 
you don’t have to worry when people leave they did not make an extra key 
you don’t have to meet repeat renters they can get in the door it’s truly amazing !

title: Great product and app
text: I love how customizable the door lock is and the instant notifications. My only knock on the app is that I wish it had a unique alert like CNBC, Wayfair, Shop, etc. The current notification sounds like so many other apps that I’m afraid I’m going to start tuning it out when it is actually a part of our security system.

title: Codes now gone
text: I have entered 5 access codes each listed to a family member, now all of the codes are not showing up and says I have 0 codes and also the history has disappeared, I tried to re-enter the codes and it won’t let me save them

title: Error
text: Love the app and having the able to check on things, schedule codes for people and even disable codes lol...but for some reason when the door is locked, on the app is will say unlocked for like 5 minutes, like a delayed response.

title: Takes tooo long and at least 2 attempts
text:
This app is ridiculous. It takes a long time to retrieve the lock. Moreover, once it retrieves the lock, it changes status to UNREACHABLE. Then it has to be done again. As I’m writing a review, it took me all together about 5 minutes to retrieve the lock. 4 attempts total.

On top of that the application asks you to sign in entering user id and password. Why?

The reason I got the electronic lock is to quickly open the door, to be faster than if I would be doing with keys. But if it takes a lot longer, what’s the point?

title: Dan
text: Love the schlage home app.  We use it for our rental apartment in Jensen Beach, Florida.  The app is great and very user friendly, but we’ve had two issues where we’ve lost our remote connectivity to the lock during long term tenant stays.  One guy had to climb thru the window to get in and both he and the other tenant needed to be walked through a factory reset for the remainder of their stays and use the default codes.

title: Loses Wifi connection - FIXED
text: Previous issue where I could not use the app to lock or unlock the door or add new pass codes was resolved! I deleted the app from my phone and re-downloaded it. Both locks appeared again and are able to be controlled.

title: Love it!
text: Absolutely, love this new keyless lock! Not sure why did not look into much it earlier. Easy to install my 14 year old son installed it. Love the app, easy to use, love the many features on the app. Love how can lock and unlock from app! Highly recommend going to get one for my sister-in-law.

title: Schlage Home app
text:
I bought an Encode for my home’s front door. Easy installation, works great, and everyone is using it and happy. I use the WiFi app a lot and have only one suggestion. For the History page, I would suggest making the open/close time tags easier to read. I review the data and can barely read the small light grey font. Perhaps a larger, darker and bold font. 
Thanks

title: It doesn’t work
text: This app doesn’t work. It won’t connect with my WiFi - and I have good WiFi. So, I can do some things with it but not a whole bunch. After a long time troubleshooting on the phone with a tech guy, he sent me a replacement, thinking I might have “a lemon.” I tried the replacement in another room with another smartphone. No luck. Now I’m stuck with a $250 smartlock that doesn’t do half of what it’s supposed to, I wasted hours, and I don’t want to pay a handyman to take it out and install something else. I am beyond disappointed in Schlage. Trash!

title: Something's gone wrong
text: App was working great up until Apple pushed out this last iPhone software update.  Now the entire Schlage Home app seems to be corrupted and is locking and unlocking doors on its own, not providing real time status updates, and showing false statuses for locked / unlocked.  I really liked this app and it worked well for the last six months but is now terrible.  Please make some fixes.  I had to delete all my doors and the app to stop it from unlocking my house randomly!!!

title: Thank you for the fixes!
text:
Thank you for fixing the crazy problems.  The entry log is easy to read and I can finally add and delete codes on the first attempt instead of having to try to save 10 times with fingers crossed. 
Much improved app.  Love the lock and the app is now much much better.

title: Trouble with the “history tab” on app
text: Hello! Since I’ve had this lock, everything works except the history tab. The history will not record consecutive days or show me the history for consecutive days but rather record and skip days of record. Is there anything that can be done other then keep deleting the app and adding it to my phone. That’s my only complaint. Everything else works fine.

title: Not great, Bob
text: Even with solid internet in the house, the lock takes forever to load on screen. When it does, it takes a long time to lock/unlock. The lock regularly shows as unavailable as well. The app is rather buggy. Often struggles to update changes I make to door codes. Firmware updates to the lock usually fail and have to be run several times before it takes. The physical lock itself is great, but the experience with the app is just horrible.

title: Best lock ever
text: I was introduced to this locking system on my trip while staying at an Airbnb, and I immediately decided this is what I wanted for my own Airbnb place. It is easy to install and super simple to use with the app.  I love that I can assign temporary codes and that I am notified anytime they are used. I can even even lock/unlock remotely. Very happy!!

title: Great but for 1 big complaint
text: Use this for an airbnb and it has been simple to add and delete guests. Occasionally I get logged out of this app. It is not named”Schlage”when looking in my list of apps w saved passwords on my phone. Almost every time I have to reset my password because I have never figured out what it is actually called. Tried to get the answer from Schlage to no avail.

title: Lock jam
text:
Our lock is getting jammed. It is only 1 month old. We arrived home in the dark and cold 5 days ago and couldn’t get any help from the company. We  finally got it open. Now I can’t undo the bolt manually. It’s a good thing we have 2 exits. We finally got it unlocked with the key after trying about 10 times. It’s a weekend and no support. 

I love it when it works.

title: Good app, but slow performance
text: For the most part I like this app. But several times when I need to unlock my door the app took a few minutes to communicate to my lock to unlock my door. Or the other problem is that the lock status is incorrect even if you refresh several times. I think the app needs improvement. It does work

title: Great Lock
text: I have a rental property that is 7 hours away. I purchased this lock and it was the best investment I’m made for my rental. It has never failed and guests have no trouble operating it. If you’re in search of a new keyless entry lock, get this one, you’ll nit be disappointed!

title: Amazing!!!!
text:
Amazing easy to use and very fast response time on the app!!!!!!! 

Have tried so many  WiFi enabled devices and this by far is the fastest and most reliable yet. I installed three in at my parents home and I know they will not have any issues with forgetting to lock their doors. 

Thank you so much and we will be using Schlage WiFi Encode in every home. 

We have been using Schlage products for a very long time in our Steel Fabrication company But this is the first time we use the Technology and WiFi products. Can’t wait to try other products from Schlage. 

Andy Nuño 

Nuño Iron Inc Mfg

title: Bad experience, pure documentation
text: Installed Encode lock okay but using app very disappointing. By default I can make only 6 digit user codes. I wanted to use 4 digits. There is no way to make the change with an app. Had to do it manually at the lock. But once I done it I lost the ability to make user keys with a app. Had to reset to factory settings but things still only half working.

title: Frustrated
text: Have 2 Schlage Sense locks.  Very happy until AppleHome was notifying me of update.  Go to Schlage app and no update showing.  Following instructions in Schlage FAQ and deleted locks. Added them to Schlage app still no updates and now can’t get them added back into HomeKit and if I could would probably have the update message again.  And update should not be difficult, should be automatic.

title: A great internet lock
text: The internet design is very convenient and thoughtful.  It not just let you know the status of the lock, but also give you the detailed action of locking and unlocking.  Only very occasionally the lock got off the network.  Love it.

title: Great app, great lock
text: This app works perfectly for notified me when my doors locked and unlocked and for being able to remotely lock and unlock my door.  I’ve had a keypad lock for years but never had this convenience of being able to remotely control it and I absolutely love it.

title: Works, but has room for improvements
text: Overall, the app does its job but the user interface can be improved. For instance, it shows a battery icon but it’s not entirely clear how much battery is left. Why not show the % charge left? (The information is there but it’s buried in some submenu).

title: Horrible
text: Sheer waste of money. Look for alternatives. Always unreachable and very unreliable. The only reason I bought this crap is as it says compatible with Apple TV. The app hardly recognizes the lock and every time there is an iOS update, it gets worse. Customer service is a pain. They are still not able to fix mine and it's been more than 2 years. Advertising it as compatible with Apple is just a gimmick. Wish I could get my money back. Terrible terrible app. Deserves no star.

title: The worst app in the App Store.
text:
The Schlage lock actually functions the way it’s supposed to when used manually. 

The point of spending all of your pennies on this lock is supposed to be the ability to use it remotely. 

The remote functionality stops working from the first firmware update. 

I have three of these locks and the loss of function is the same across all locks. I am running a hospitality business and this cause great inconvenience. 

Customers have been complaining about this app for years to no avail and the company has done nothing to rectify the firmware issue. 

I wouldn’t recommend this lock to anyone. The loss of remote access renders the lock useless. 

You may as well purchase a manual keyless and save yourself the money. 

If you are looking for a remote lock solution... purchase a different brand.

title: Notifications stopped working after recent update
text: The lock and everything was working fine until the recent update. Now I stopped getting notifications on my iPhone about it being locked or unlocked and that is a very important detail to stop working as there is high traffic of people entering and leaving our home with some forgetful of locking the door.

title: Wifi will reach doorbell but not the lock
